channel.title: mycatalog updates
channel.description: 'My Catalog' uses the IBM Cloud catalog API to retrieve data from the catalog. It attempts to be as accurate as possible. This feed shows additions, updates, removals from the catalog. Use with care. It is a work-in-progress :)

item.title: [added] BrightAgent (brighthive)
item.description: BrightAgent is your agentic data companion that makes the end to end complex data analysis work easy for everyone!

item.title: [added] heimr.co - Cloud Professional Services (heimr-cps01)
item.description: We can manage and migrate your IBM Cloud environment

item.title: [updated] Db2 (dashdb-for-transactions) has changed the description of the plan named performance
item.description:
*before*: Base configuration starts with 4 vCPUs, 16 GB of RAM, 400 IOPS and 50GB of storage.
The starting configuration provides one SQL database per service instance residing on dedicated VPC machines. Scale your database up to 128 vCPUs (1024 GB of memory) and 40 TB of storage for data and logs. Gen 3 offers a high availability option that includes one database running on two dedicated virtual servers. The high availability instances are provisioned across multiple availability zones. Scale your compute, storage and IOPS independently to achieve the perfect price/performance fit.
The service is billed hourly based on the number of resource units. Monthly resource units are shown for machine types during selection. Storage requires 0.0125 RU per 20 GB/month and 0.0375 RU per 100 IOPS/month. Backups require 0.3125 RU per TB/month., *after*: Base configuration starts with 4 vCPUs, 16 GB of RAM, 400 IOPS and 50GB of storage.
The starting configuration provides one SQL database per service instance residing on dedicated VPC machines. Scale your database up to 128 vCPUs (1024 GB of memory) and 40 TB of storage for data and logs. Gen 3 offers a high availability option that includes one database running on two dedicated virtual servers. The high availability instances are provisioned across multiple availability zones. Scale your compute, storage and IOPS independently to achieve the perfect price/performance fit.
The service is billed hourly based on the number of resource units. Monthly resource units are shown for machine types during selection. Storage requires 2 RU per 20 GB/month and 5.7 RU per 100 IOPS/month. Backups require 52.5 RU per TB/month.
